decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The use shall not commence until all external doors to the premises have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, odour, smoke or fumes.</p>

Notwithstanding the provisions set out in Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), or in any provision equivalent to those Orders in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order, the use here permitted shall be for synagogue purposes only and for no other purposes including any other purpose in Class F1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended).


REASON: To protect the amenity of adjoining occupiers.

The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development shall at all times remain 5dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window or other sensitive receptor if appropriate (add/delete as appropriate)


REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.

No, meter boxes, antennas, satellite dishes, soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

The windows in the north elevation at first, second and third floor levels shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut and shall be retained in perpetuity thereafter. 


REASON: To protect the amenity of adjoining occupiers.

<p>The use hereby permitted may only operate between 0900 hours and 2330 hours on any day.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>
REASON: To ensure that the use is operated in a satisfactory manner and does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.</p>

<p>The landscaping scheme hereby approved as part of the development shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of three years, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of providing appropriate green space and landscaping.&nbsp;</p>

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture.</p><p><br></p><p>

REASON: In the interest of preserving the character and appearance of the existing building.&nbsp;</p>

<p>No tannoys or public address systems shall be used, unless details have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Approved details shall be implemented prior to use and thereafter be permanently retained.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

Soundproofing shall be provided to ensure that dwelling houses, flats and rooms for residential purposes sharing a party element with a premises to which this planning permission relates shall receive a minimum airborne sound insulation on the party element which achieves DnT'w of 60 dB before the first use of the development hereby approved. The soundproofing shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.


REASON: To ensure that neighbouring occupiers do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise from activities within the premises

<p>Except on days of collection, all refuse and waste shall be stored in sealed containers in the refuse area shown on the plans hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure refuse is not left in the street in the interest of visual amenity.</p>
description: Retrospective application for the retention of 'as-built' three-storey synagogue (use class F1(f)). Proposed works to include enlargement of existing basement with installation of door on western elevation and replacement of windows on southern and eastern elevations.
